discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -126,6 +127,7 @@ export interface ExtensionStateContextType extends ExtensionState {

discussion_comments.comment_body: suggestion: something like `setNotificationDismissed` or anything with `set` since this is a bit the convention here. No blocker if you disagree.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -126,6 +127,7 @@ export interface ExtensionStateContextType extends ExtensionState {
 	setEnhancementApiConfigId: (value: string) => void
 	commitMessageApiConfigId?: string // kilocode_change
 	setCommitMessageApiConfigId: (value: string) => void // kilocode_change
+	markNotificationAsDismissed: (notificationId: string) => void // kilocode_change
discussion_comments.comment_body: the reason we choose for another name is that set also implies you can pass in a value, whereas this will always add it to the dismissed set

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Copilot had a low confidence comment on this which sounded sensible:

> [nitpick] The title prefix is inconsistent with Button.stories.tsx (Component/Button). Rename "UI/Badge" to match > your new organization (e.g., "Component/Badge").
>	title: "UI/Badge",
	
In general I notice that the low confidence comments are typically hit or miss, but the hits are often more helpful than regular comments (don't know if you ever check them, but I'd recommend to do so)
